programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
The fifth and final week of heats gets under way, with another nine contestants aiming to impress Gregg Wallace and John Torode in the opening Audition Round. John and Gregg don't witness them cook in the MasterChef kitchen, but taste each dish in the Tasting Room and judge each contestant's food solely on the plate that is put in front of them. After tasting all nine plates, they pick their three favourite dishes, giving those cooks a well-earned MasterChef apron and immunity from cooking in the next round
S19E13

programme.title: Eurovision Calling: Jason and Chelcee's Ultimate Guide
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford and singer-songwriter Chelcee Grimes explore how the Eurovision Song Contest became the world's largest live music event. Jason meets the UK's last winner, Katrina Leskanich from Katrina and the Waves, Sam Ryder, who came second in 2022's contest, and Mae Muller, who is representing the UK this year. Chelcee provides an exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpse of preparations in Liverpool, as well as revealing some little-known facts about the event itself

Fleur East and a panel of celebrity Eurovision super-fans toast the 20 most successful Eurovision songs that didn't win. These are entrants whose songs have gone on to rack up millions of internet views and streams worldwide. Contributors include Claire Sweeney, Scott Mills and Paddy O'Connell

They must prepare two courses that will impress not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also from the 2014 series Ping Coombes, the 2015 series Simon Wood and 2020 series finalist Claire Fyfe

programme.title: Have I Got News for You

S65E05

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc:
Undercover police officers Dom and Kay are in a mess - frightened and on their own they have Clinton's body to bury. Dom recalls that Clinton said he was 'protected' and reasons that someone else must know about this mission. They decide to head to Clinton's house, but on the way bump into fellow PCSO Kieran Price who questions their very shaky story about why they're caked in mud. Clinton's house yields an interesting discovery - but Dom and Kay are not the only ones breaking in. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo, Hammed Animashaun and Colin Hoult

programme.desc:

Featuring Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: The Monuments Men (2014)
programme.desc: Seven experts in fine art are assembled into a military platoon during the Second World War, and given an unusual mission. They are sent into occupied Europe to recover priceless works of art that have fallen into Nazi hands and ensure the masterpieces survive the conflict. Fact-based drama, directed by and starring George Clooney. With Matt Damon, Bill Murray and Cate Blanchett

In Liverpool, she joins the team from Homebaked Bakery, a goal kick away from Liverpool FC's stadium, who take on the job of feeding fans on match day. She also meets Andrew, whose passion to feed has led him to build a smokehouse in his suburban garden. Between these tales, Mary cooks up her own crowd-pleasing delights, including a platter of sticky soy and ginger pork, and a lamb rogan curry

programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents the run-up to the historic occasion from a studio outside Buckingham Palace, where she is joined by a range of guests including friends and colleagues of the royal couple. programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents live coverage of the historic event as crowds gather to celebrate the Coronation of Charles III and the Queen Consort. programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: The pageantry continues as the newly crowned King Charles and Queen Camilla head back to Buckingham Palace in the Coronation Procession, where they are received at the Mall and make their traditional balcony appearance. Presented by Sophie Raworth, with commentary by Huw Edwards

programme.desc: A baby princess's hair has mystical powers, so an evil witch kidnaps her and locks her in a tower, hoping to use the magic to fend off old age. programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.title: The Jungle Book (2016)
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year
S2023E19

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.desc: The latest political news and debate from the region

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Coronation Kitchen Live: Matt Tebbutt is joined by Jennie Bond and Gyles Brandreth for a special celebratory edition of the show to mark the Coronation of King Charles III. Chefs Adam Byatt and Anna Haugh are also in the studio to rustle up royal recipes, and resident expert Helen McGinn has an array of drinks perfect for any celebration

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.title: Coronation: the UK Celebrates - Live
programme.desc: Reports from around the nation about how people marked the occasion of the crowning of King Charles and Queen Camilla yesterday

programme.title: The Jungle Book (2016)
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Look North
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year
S2023E19

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: To mark to coronation of King Charles, this special edition of the show goes back through the archives to celebrate items with a royal connection. Fiona Bruce is intrigued by a collection of coronation souvenirs from the past that have been preserved in the Museum of Brands, and ceramics expert Serhat Ahmet offers tips on the most collectable coronation keepsakes

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.title: Eurovision Welcomes The World
programme.desc: Rylan and Sunetra Sarker kick off Eurovision with highlights from this year's Turquoise Carpet welcome event, as the performers arrive in Liverpool. Semi-final hosts Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina gear up for their presenting debut together and Rylan spends time backstage to see all of the final Eurovision preparations. The show also features highlights from Liverpool's Big Eurovision Welcome event taking place outside St George's Hall, presented by AJ Odudu and Joel Dommett, where Frankie Goes to Hollywood will be on stage together for the first time in more than 30 years. Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. Special guests Ricky Tomlinson and Shirley Ballas pay tribute to their home city and international pop star Zara Larsson join icons of dance music Cream Classical to close the show

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
The fifth and final week of heats gets under way, with another nine contestants aiming to impress Gregg Wallace and John Torode in the opening Audition Round. John and Gregg don't witness them cook in the MasterChef kitchen, but taste each dish in the Tasting Room and judge each contestant's food solely on the plate that is put in front of them. After tasting all nine plates, they pick their three favourite dishes, giving those cooks a well-earned MasterChef apron and immunity from cooking in the next round
S19E13

programme.title: Eurovision Calling: Jason and Chelcee's Ultimate Guide
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford and singer-songwriter Chelcee Grimes explore how the Eurovision Song Contest became the world's largest live music event. Jason meets the UK's last winner, Katrina Leskanich from Katrina and the Waves, Sam Ryder, who came second in 2022's contest, and Mae Muller, who is representing the UK this year. Chelcee provides an exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpse of preparations in Liverpool, as well as revealing some little-known facts about the event itself

programme.desc:
Undercover police officers Dom and Kay are in a mess - frightened and on their own they have Clinton's body to bury. Dom recalls that Clinton said he was 'protected' and reasons that someone else must know about this mission. They decide to head to Clinton's house, but on the way bump into fellow PCSO Kieran Price who questions their very shaky story about why they're caked in mud. Clinton's house yields an interesting discovery - but Dom and Kay are not the only ones breaking in. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo, Hammed Animashaun and Colin Hoult

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

They decide to head to Clinton's house, but on the way bump into fellow PCSO Kieran Price who questions their very shaky story about why they're caked in mud. programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: 06/05/2023: Naga Munchetty and Charlie Stayt present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents the run-up to the historic occasion from a studio outside Buckingham Palace, where she is joined by a range of guests including friends and colleagues of the royal couple. Throughout the morning, a series of films explore the King's passions, while across the capital a team of presenters are in key locations to report and commentate on the day as events unfold. JJ Chalmers speaks to the men and women of the armed forces as they take their positions, Anita Rani meets members of the public and Sophie Raworth is outside Westminster Abbey

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents live coverage of the historic event as crowds gather to celebrate the Coronation of Charles III and the Queen Consort. Viewers will have a front-row seat of the King's Procession makes it way through the streets of London, from Buckingham Palace to Westminster Abbey, where Sophie Raworth speaks to guests as they arrive and Huw Edwards provides commentary on the ancient ceremony itself

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: The pageantry continues as the newly crowned King Charles and Queen Camilla head back to Buckingham Palace in the Coronation Procession, where they are received at the Mall and make their traditional balcony appearance. Presented by Sophie Raworth, with commentary by Huw Edwards

programme.title: Take Me to the Opera
programme.desc:
Zeinab Badawi finds out how the opera world is making itself fit for the future and what it takes to become a top opera star. Zeinab travels to La Scala in Milan to hear about the rigours of training for aspiring opera singers and to explore the unsung heroes who help make the magic of opera happen.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: 06/05/2023: Naga Munchetty and Charlie Stayt present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents the run-up to the historic occasion from a studio outside Buckingham Palace, where she is joined by a range of guests including friends and colleagues of the royal couple. Throughout the morning, a series of films explore the King's passions, while across the capital a team of presenters are in key locations to report and commentate on the day as events unfold. JJ Chalmers speaks to the men and women of the armed forces as they take their positions, Anita Rani meets members of the public and Sophie Raworth is outside Westminster Abbey

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents live coverage of the historic event as crowds gather to celebrate the Coronation of Charles III and the Queen Consort. Viewers will have a front-row seat of the King's Procession makes it way through the streets of London, from Buckingham Palace to Westminster Abbey, where Sophie Raworth speaks to guests as they arrive and Huw Edwards provides commentary on the ancient ceremony itself

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: The pageantry continues as the newly crowned King Charles and Queen Camilla head back to Buckingham Palace in the Coronation Procession, where they are received at the Mall and make their traditional balcony appearance. Presented by Sophie Raworth, with commentary by Huw Edwards

programme.desc: General

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Absolute Desert: Michael reaches the city of Timbuktu, along with a camel train carrying the giant salt blocks that made the city one of the greatest centres of Islamic learning. Later, Michael finally gets to grips with the heart and soul of the desert
S01E03

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
A Passage to India: The adventurer continues his journey, travelling from K2 in Pakistan to Ladakh in India, a relatively short distance geographically, but one that will take a considerable feat of logistics owing to the region's politics. He passes through the Sikh city of Amritsar, spends time on a houseboat on Lake Dal, discovers his previous incarnations at the Astrological Institute, then travels on to an appointment with the Dalai Lama
S01E02

programme.title: Homeward (2019)
programme.desc: Mustafa, a Crimean Tatar, and his son Alim transport the body of Mustafa's other son, a soldier killed in combat, from Kyiv to Crimea to give him a proper burial. Drama, starring Akhtem Seitablaev and Remzi Bilyalov. In Crimean Tatar, Ukrainian and Russian

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc:
Golden Gordon: Michael Palin and Terry Jones wrote this classic comedy, in which Palin stars as a soccer fan whose obsession with the world's worst team causes misery for both him and his long-suffering family. With Gwen Taylor and Bill Fraser. First shown in 1979
S02E02

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc:
Roger of the Raj: Youngster Roger Bartlesham experiences a sexual awakening in colonial India, but the emotional turmoil leads him to commit a deplorable act. Final episode of the comedy series, starring Michael Palin, Richard Vernon, John Le Mesurier and Joan Sanderson. First shown in 1979
S02E03

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
Why?: Lionel becomes suspicious of Alistair's overwhelming desire for his book to be a success. Comedy, starring Geoffrey Palmer and Judi Dench
S02E04

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
Cold Feet: Bob has doubts about his marriage when he realises all his peers - even the vicar - seem to be getting divorced. Classic comedy, starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam
S01E03

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc:
Beyond the Rainbow: Dr Helen Czerski tells the story of scientific endeavour, revealing the secrets of the universe as she takes to the skies in a jumbo jet, equipped with an infra-red telescope. She explores how the birds and the bees, who can see ultraviolet, view the world, and looks at how x-rays can be used to harness colours and image the human body as never before, thereby opening up new ways to treat disease
S01E03

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Dire Straits: The actor embarks on the last leg of his journey, passing through the dramatic mountains of the Hoggar Massif, visiting Libya and crossing into Tunisia, where he relives the filming of The Life of Brian. He also visits Algiers and the Spanish enclave of Ceuta before finishing the expedition where he started - Gibraltar
S01E04

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
A Passage to India: The adventurer continues his journey, travelling from K2 in Pakistan to Ladakh in India, a relatively short distance geographically, but one that will take a considerable feat of logistics owing to the region's politics. He passes through the Sikh city of Amritsar, spends time on a houseboat on Lake Dal, discovers his previous incarnations at the Astrological Institute, then travels on to an appointment with the Dalai Lama
S01E02

programme.title: The Queen's Realm
programme.desc: The last of three programmes originally shown in 1977 to celebrate Queen Elizabeth's Silver Jubilee, and celebrating the landscape of England, Scotland and Wales from a unique perspective. Here, Iain Cuthbertson narrates this documentary taking a helicopter's-eye view of Scotland, taking viewers north to Shetland, south to the Tweed and everywhere in between

programme.title: Spring Soul and Jazz from Cheltenham
programme.desc: Guy Barker's Big Band and the BBC Concert Orchestra join forces at the Cheltenham Jazz Festival, with guest performers including Kurt Elling, Mica Paris, Madeline Bell, Mica Millar, Ashton Jones, Vanessa Haynes, Tommy Blaize and Ian Shaw. They play music celebrating the jazz and soul explosion of the late 1950s, and with over 80 musicians on stage and a great line-up of guests, it promises to be an extraordinary night of music. Presented by Marcus Brigstocke

programme.title: Crossing England in a Punt: River of Dreams
programme.desc: Tom Fort embarks on a 170-mile journey down the River Trent in his own custom-built punt. The presenter encounters the power stations that generate much of the nation's electricity, meets veterans of the floods of 1947 and learns about a Bronze Age boatman who made a life on the banks as he discovers the waterway's 3,000-year history

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Resident choreographer at the Royal Ballet and director of his own dance company, Wayne McGregor's dance achievements know no bounds both at home and internationally. Alan Yentob joins Wayne over a busy few months, from his role as director at the Venice Dance Biennale, creating a new production with his own company of dancers, to the rehearsals and opening of The Dante Project, a new ballet at the Royal Opera House in London

programme.title: Berlin 1945
programme.desc:
Life in the German capital in the year the Second World War ended, told through the stories of those who experienced it - from ordinary Germans to the Allied forces who entered the city. At the beginning of 1945, Berlin remains under the spell of the Nazi promise of salvation, an illusion at odds with the city's daily reality of bombing raids, fires to be extinguished and corpses to be buried. Life goes on as the front lines of the war close in each day
S01E01

programme.title: The Queen's Realm
programme.desc: The last of three programmes originally shown in 1977 to celebrate Queen Elizabeth's Silver Jubilee, and celebrating the landscape of England, Scotland and Wales from a unique perspective. Here, Iain Cuthbertson narrates this documentary taking a helicopter's-eye view of Scotland, taking viewers north to Shetland, south to the Tweed and everywhere in between

programme.title: Victoria & Albert: The Royal Wedding
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley oversees a restaging of the wedding of Queen Victoria and Prince Albert. Aided by food historian Annie Gray, clothing expert Harriet Waterhouse and military historian Jasdeep Singh, she recreates the most important elements of the ceremony and the celebrations, scouring history books, archives, newspapers and Victoria's diaries for the exact details of the couple's big day in 1840. Lucy also recounts the story of Victoria and Albert's courtship and engagement, exploring the hidden iconography and symbolism of this hugely significant wedding and revealing new insights into the pair's relationship, both public and private

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Kuala Lumpur to Melaka: Michael Portillo explores the growth of Kuala Lumpur, from a swampland tin mine to a major British colony, before becoming a major economic powerhouse in its own right. He makers jewellery at the Royal Selangor pewter factory, samples Malaysia's national dish, and investigates the scandalous behaviour of an infamous British resident general at the turn of the 20th century
S01E17

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc:
The Early Pioneers: The development of steam power, from the earliest experiments in the ancient world to modern-day nuclear power stations. Fred travels to Cornwall to investigate the use of early engines to pump water out of the tin mines
S01E01

programme.title: Cornwall's Red River
programme.desc: Poet John Wedgwood Clarke explores the Red River in Cornwall. Despite being heavily polluted by centuries of tin mining, it is also home to some rare and resilient wildlife

programme.title: David Attenborough's Zoo Quest in Colour
programme.desc: A one-off special showcasing colour footage from the 1950s wildlife series that launched the career of a young David Attenborough as a nature presenter. Using new-found film and behind-the-scenes stories from Attenborough and cameraman Charles Lague, this programme features clips of the best of Zoo Quest to West Africa, Zoo Quest to Guiana and Zoo Quest for a Dragon

programme.title: David Attenborough: A Life on Air
programme.desc: In 1952, David Attenborough was turned down for a job with BBC radio, only to end up working for the corporation's fledgling TV service - eventually becoming director of programmes. Since then he has become one of the most respected wildlife film-makers in the business, fronting classic series such as Life on Earth, The Blue Planet and Planet Earth. He talks to Michael Palin about his half-century at the corporation

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alice Neel: Imagine: Born in 1900, American artist Alice Neel portrayed the 20th century until her death in 1984, painting the people around her - those on the margins of society as well as the ones involved in her own hard and complicated life. This profile of Neel was made by her grandson Andrew, who combines home-movie footage and candid interviews with family and friends

programme.title: H2O: The Molecule That Made Us
programme.desc:
Pulse: Documentary exploring the importance of water to civilisation, beginning with a look at how just a few drops can cause deserts to bloom, create rivers in the air and drive the great animal migrations
S01E01

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
What Happens in Helmand: Holliday Grainger and Callum Turner star in a six-part crime thriller. Soldier Shaun Emery has his conviction for murder overturned because of flawed evidence, and returns home to Britain a free man. However, when damning CCTV footage of him comes to light, he ends up the subject of another investigation. Newly promoted detective Rachel Carey is assigned to the case, and quickly learns the truth is not as simple as it appears
S01E01

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Toy Soldier: The crucial CCTV footage of Shaun's supposed crime is seized by a mysterious MI5 officer, leaving Rachel convinced the truth behind the case is not as clear cut as it first appeared. However, getting answers may prove difficult when the surveillance system is found wanting. After a confrontation with his ex-partner, Shaun is determined to prove his innocence, and recruits an old friend to help him break into Hannah's flat and find evidence. Ron Perlman (Hellboy) joins the cast of the conspiracy thriller
S01E02

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Truffle Hog: Shaun is interrogated by the CIA in a covert safe house, and while Rachel sees CCTV footage of him going in, she then finds she is unable to locate him inside. Her investigation leads her to make shocking discoveries about the degree to which CCTV footage might be manipulated. Finally released by his American captors, Shaun goes on the run from the police - but his quest to clear his name soon takes a devastating turn
S01E03

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Melaka to Johor Bahru: Michael Portillo arrives in Melaka, for centuries one of the greatest trading ports in the world, where he tastes the spicy cuisine of the Kristang community. Continuing to Kluang amid fertile farmland, Michael joins in the pineapple harvest and discovers how Malaysia's resources of tin and tropical fruit created a global market in food. Finally, he arrives at the tip of the Malaysian peninsula in Johor Bahru
S01E18

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc:
The Age of the Steam Locomotive: The revolution in transport brought about by steam power, charting the technology's development from the earliest colliery railways, through the first passenger train services and to the end of an era in the 1960s
S01E02

programme.title: Sykes
programme.desc:
Stranger: Eric and Hattie are visited by a stranger who has returned to honour a promise made in his childhood. Vintage comedy first shown in 1972, guest starring Peter Sellers alongside Hattie Jacques and Eric Sykes
S01E06

programme.title: Sykes
programme.desc:
Spy Ring: Eric and Hattie become suspicious of their vodka-swilling, well-off new neighbours. Vintage comedy, starring Eric Sykes and Hattie Jacques
S02E03

programme.title: Eric Sykes: One of the Great Troupers
programme.desc: The veteran comedian takes to the stage of the Theatre Royal, Lincoln, where he gives a tongue-in-cheek account of his follies and fortunes as an actor, gag writer and comedian in theatre, radio and TV. He also pays tribute to Hattie Jacques and Richard Watts, the co-stars of his long-running Sykes sitcom, and there are appearances from Eddie Lester, John Evans and Tony Hayes

programme.title: Wild Scotland
programme.desc: Gordon Buchanan takes a trip home to the island of Mull where he has just one day to film the rare sea eagle. While searching for a nest site, he spots a host of other wildlife

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: UK artist and film-maker Lisa Selby turns the camera on herself as she tries to understand her relationship with her late mother and her partner, both heroin addicts

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Melaka to Johor Bahru: Michael Portillo arrives in Melaka, for centuries one of the greatest trading ports in the world, where he tastes the spicy cuisine of the Kristang community. Continuing to Kluang amid fertile farmland, Michael joins in the pineapple harvest and discovers how Malaysia's resources of tin and tropical fruit created a global market in food. Finally, he arrives at the tip of the Malaysian peninsula in Johor Bahru
S01E18

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc:
The Age of the Steam Locomotive: The revolution in transport brought about by steam power, charting the technology's development from the earliest colliery railways, through the first passenger train services and to the end of an era in the 1960s
S01E02

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Blind Spots: Rachel finally comes face to face with Shaun, who offers up the location of the CIA safe house before managing to evade arrest once more. The fugitive soldier flees into an encounter with two mysterious strangers, who offer to provide him with the answers he is looking for. Rachel pays Napier a visit, and the meeting leaves her more convinced than ever that the CCTV network has been compromised
S01E04

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
A Pilgrim of Justice: The truth behind what happened to Shaun is revealed to him as he finally comes face to face with the powers behind his downfall. Rachel seeks answers of her own after her suspicions that Shaun has been set up are confirmed by a vital piece of evidence. However, the truth they both uncover places their lives in great danger
S01E05

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Correction: The mysterious Jessica Mallory arrives in London as the most closely guarded secrets of the intelligence services face exposure. Rachel faces a terrible choice that will not only decide Shaun's fate but also have an impact on the nation's entire criminal justice system. Famke Janssen (X-Men) guest stars in the conclusion of the crime drama
S01E06

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Raffles Place to Botanic Gardens: Michael Portillo's tour reaches its final stop, Singapore, where he learns about the island city's maritime origins and the vision of the 19th-century Englishman who put it on the map. At the bar of the Raffles Hotel, he treats himself to a Singapore sling, now a world-famous cocktail, takes a boat down the river and dines with an artist and his family in Chinatown
S01E19

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc:
Driving the Wheels of Industry: The steeplejack takes a look at the extraordinary expansion of industrial Britain in the 18th and 19th centuries, and the continued use of huge steam engines in collieries, steelworks and mills in the 20th century
S01E03

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc:
Travellers: Chris takes a look at nature's best navigators, with mule deer building up complicated memory maps of their landscapes so they don't get lost, while elephants rely on the knowledge of the herd's matriarch to find precious waterholes. Dung beetles plot routes by reading the stars, while the mantis shrimp has one of the most complex navigation systems in the natural world. For many species of fish and birds, there's safety in numbers and they often travel in vast shoals and flocks - but who leads the way, and how do they decide?
S01E06

programme.title: World of Stonehenge
programme.desc: Neil Oliver reports on a 5,000-year-old temple discovered in Orkney. Built 500 years before Stonehenge, the undisturbed artefacts found there, including wall decorations, pigments and paint pots, are helping to increase knowledge and understanding of the Neolithic people. Special effects are used to re-create the structure in 3D, allowing Neil to walk inside and explore it

programme.title: The Lost Language of Cranes (1991)
programme.desc: A young man comes out to his parents, causing repercussions for his father, who has long since been trying his own sexuality and realises he can no longer live a lie. Drama, starring Brian Cox, Brian Cox, Eileen Atkins and Angus Macfadyen

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc:
Adventure & Exploration: Broadcaster David Dimbleby sails his yacht Rocket around the British coastline, exploring different aspects of the nation's maritime history, art and architecture along the way. He begins by sailing the south-west coast of Devon and Cornwall, where he tells the story of Sir Francis Drake and an array of adventurers, explorers, pirates and smugglers. He also welcomes record-breaking solo yachtswoman Ellen MacArthur on board and learns about one of the oldest maritime art forms of all - the tattoo, before agreeing to have one himself
S01E01

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Raffles Place to Botanic Gardens: Michael Portillo's tour reaches its final stop, Singapore, where he learns about the island city's maritime origins and the vision of the 19th-century Englishman who put it on the map. At the bar of the Raffles Hotel, he treats himself to a Singapore sling, now a world-famous cocktail, takes a boat down the river and dines with an artist and his family in Chinatown
S01E19

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc:
Driving the Wheels of Industry: The steeplejack takes a look at the extraordinary expansion of industrial Britain in the 18th and 19th centuries, and the continued use of huge steam engines in collieries, steelworks and mills in the 20th century
S01E03

programme.title: H2O: The Molecule That Made Us
programme.desc:
Pulse: Documentary exploring the importance of water to civilisation, beginning with a look at how just a few drops can cause deserts to bloom, create rivers in the air and drive the great animal migrations
S01E01

programme.title: Crossing England in a Punt: River of Dreams
programme.desc: Tom Fort embarks on a 170-mile journey down the River Trent in his own custom-built punt. The presenter encounters the power stations that generate much of the nation's electricity, meets veterans of the floods of 1947 and learns about a Bronze Age boatman who made a life on the banks as he discovers the waterway's 3,000-year history

programme.title: London to Brighton: Side By Side
programme.desc: In 1953, the BBC commissioned a recording filmed from the point-of-view of a London to Brighton train. In 1983, another film of the same journey was recorded. This short programme presents these two iconic recordings side-by-side, demonstrating how both locomotive technology and the landscape have evolved over the years

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Chinatown to Gardens by the Bay: Michael Portillo is in the island city-state of Singapore on the last leg of his 2,500-mile exploration of south-east Asia. In Tai Seng he marvels at the world's largest subterranean rail depot where self-driving MRT trains are operated. He then takes a cable car to the island of Sentosa where he learns about one of Britain's worst military defeats and the brutal Japanese occupation that followed. At the Singapore Stock Exchange, Michael appreciates the island's success as a financial centre and, in the residential district of Ang Mo Kio, visits an urban farm of the future - on a car park roof
S01E20

programme.title: Ken Dodd's Liverpool Walkabout
programme.desc: A tour of Liverpool with comedian Ken Dodd, a proud lifelong resident of the city's Knotty Ash district

programme.title: Ken Dodd: How Tickled We Were
programme.desc: A celebration of the life and work of the comedian, recounting his life from his boyhood growing up in the 1930s in Knotty Ash through to his big break and continued career in showbusiness. Dodd's career spanned 50 years and after his rapid rise to stardom, he maintained his presence via countless television and radio shows, theatre tours and summer seasons with work ranging from pantomime to Shakespeare. He also enjoyed a spell as a successful recording artist and remained active until just a few months before his death aged 90. This programme features contributions from his friends and colleagues and includes an interview with his widow Anne

programme.title: The Shawshank Redemption (1994)
programme.desc: A banker is wrongly jailed for his wife's murder and over the course of a life sentence he forms a close friendship with a fellow inmate. He also earns a position of trust as book-keeper to the corrupt prison governor - but makes an enemy of his benefactor as he tries to clear his name. Frank Darabont's drama, starring Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton, William Sadler, Clancy Brown and Gil Bellows

programme.title: Film Stars Don't Die in Liverpool (2017)
programme.desc: Real life proves to be just as dramatic off-screen as it does on it for ageing Hollywood superstar Gloria Grahame and her much younger lover, Peter Turner. As their mismatched romance waxes and wanes over time, events conspire to keep them in each other's lives even when it proves to be difficult and demanding. Romantic drama, starring Jamie Bell and Annette Bening

programme.title: Deep Ocean
programme.desc:
Deep Ocean: Giants of the Antarctic Deep: Documentary about the first scientific research undertaken in a submersible in the Antarctic. Three marine biologists use customised UHD cameras to capture ling the extraordinary forms of life that thrive in the Southern Ocean on film. Narrated by David Attenborough
S01E04

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Chinatown to Gardens by the Bay: Michael Portillo is in the island city-state of Singapore on the last leg of his 2,500-mile exploration of south-east Asia. In Tai Seng he marvels at the world's largest subterranean rail depot where self-driving MRT trains are operated. He then takes a cable car to the island of Sentosa where he learns about one of Britain's worst military defeats and the brutal Japanese occupation that followed. At the Singapore Stock Exchange, Michael appreciates the island's success as a financial centre and, in the residential district of Ang Mo Kio, visits an urban farm of the future - on a car park roof

He begins by sailing the south-west coast of Devon and Cornwall, where he tells the story of Sir Francis Drake and an array of adventurers, explorers, pirates and smugglers. programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 08/09/1994: East 17 singers Brian Harvey and Tony Mortimer present chart hits from September 8, 1994, featuring Blondie, Corona, the Wonder Stuff, Cyndi Lauper, Oasis, Pet Shop Boys, Kylie Minogue, Bon Jovi, Wet Wet Wet and Whigfield

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Simon Mayo introduces studio performances and videos from September 15, 1994, featuring Sophie B Hawkins, the Grid, Lisa Loeb and Nine Stories, M-Beat featuring General Levy, REM, Sinead O'Connor, Elvis Presley, Luther Vandross and Mariah Carey, Whigfield and Simple Minds

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 08/05/1986: Featuring performances by Patti LaBelle and Michael McDonald, Spitting Image, Billy Ocean, Falco and Whitney Houston. Presented by Janice Long and John Peel. From 8 May 1986

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 14/05/1992: Mark Franklin and Claudia Simon host the edition first aired on May 14 1992. Featuring performances by Shakespears Sister, the Wedding Present, Del Amitri, Kris Kross, En Vogue, Celine Dion and Peabo Bryson, CeCe Peniston and KWS

programme.title: Paul McCartney at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of TV appearances from the musician's post-Beatles career, featuring performances of songs including Band on the Run, Jet, Coming Up and Live and Let Die on programmes from Top of the Pops to the Electric Proms. There is also rarely seen backstage footage and interviews, as well as appearances by a range of familiar faces, including a recent encounter with die-hard Beatles fan Bob Mortimer

programme.title: Rock Family Trees
programme.desc:
The Mersey Sound: Rock Family Trees: The Liverpool music scene of the 1960s, an era synonymous with the band that changed the face of pop music - the Beatles. Pete Frame narrates the story of such bands including the Searchers, Gerry and the Pacemakers, Billy J Kramer, the Swinging Blue Jeans and the Merseybeats
S01E06

programme.title: Everything: The Real Thing Story
programme.desc: The rise of four working class boys from one of Liverpool's toughest neighbourhoods, who fought hardship and discrimination to become the biggest-selling black group in British pop history. With a string of hits, they dominated the international charts throughout the 1970s with iconic songs like You to Me Are Everything, Can't Get by Without You, and Can You Feel the Force. Hpwever the group's meteoric success was also tempered with personal tragedy, drug addiction and racial prejudice. Narrated by Jacob Anderson

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 08/09/1994: East 17 singers Brian Harvey and Tony Mortimer present chart hits from September 8, 1994, featuring Blondie, Corona, the Wonder Stuff, Cyndi Lauper, Oasis, Pet Shop Boys, Kylie Minogue, Bon Jovi, Wet Wet Wet and Whigfield

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Simon Mayo introduces studio performances and videos from September 15, 1994, featuring Sophie B Hawkins, the Grid, Lisa Loeb and Nine Stories, M-Beat featuring General Levy, REM, Sinead O'Connor, Elvis Presley, Luther Vandross and Mariah Carey, Whigfield and Simple Minds

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 08/05/1986: Featuring performances by Patti LaBelle and Michael McDonald, Spitting Image, Billy Ocean, Falco and Whitney Houston. Presented by Janice Long and John Peel. From 8 May 1986

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 14/05/1992: Mark Franklin and Claudia Simon host the edition first aired on May 14 1992. Featuring performances by Shakespears Sister, the Wedding Present, Del Amitri, Kris Kross, En Vogue, Celine Dion and Peabo Bryson, CeCe Peniston and KWS

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Dire Straits: The actor embarks on the last leg of his journey, passing through the dramatic mountains of the Hoggar Massif, visiting Libya and crossing into Tunisia, where he relives the filming of The Life of Brian. He also visits Algiers and the Spanish enclave of Ceuta before finishing the expedition where he started - Gibraltar
S01E04

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Annapurna to Everest: In the village of Lekhani in Nepal, Michael watches potential Gurkha recruits being put through their paces. He then commences the 4,200m ascent to Annapurna Base Camp to help him acclimatise. Next he heads off to Kathmandu to fulfil a regal engagement at the king's palace during the sacred festival of Desain, and observes holy men at the Siva shrine of Pashupatinath
S01E03

programme.title: Inspector Montalbano
programme.desc:
The Catalanotti Method: Feature-length final episode of the Italian crime drama. Montalbano grapples with the murder of the leader of an amateur dramatics company whose peculiar take on theatre borders on fanaticism. His assailant stabbed him in the chest, but without leaving a trace of blood. Might the key to discovering the identity of the killer be bound up in Catalanotti's disturbing conception of the stage? In Italian
S15E01

programme.title: The Bermuda Triangle: Beneath the Waves
programme.desc: Bruce Denardo explores the legend of the region where many planes and ships have disappeared in mysterious circumstances. Using a state-of-the-art submarine, Graham Hawkes reveals how five wrecks ended up 730ft down in the heart of the deadly expanse of water

programme.title: David Attenborough: A Life on Air
programme.desc: In 1952, David Attenborough was turned down for a job with BBC radio, only to end up working for the corporation's fledgling TV service - eventually becoming director of programmes. Since then he has become one of the most respected wildlife film-makers in the business, fronting classic series such as Life on Earth, The Blue Planet and Planet Earth. He talks to Michael Palin about his half-century at the corporation

programme.title: Sykes
programme.desc:
Stranger: Eric and Hattie are visited by a stranger who has returned to honour a promise made in his childhood. Vintage comedy first shown in 1972, guest starring Peter Sellers alongside Hattie Jacques and Eric Sykes
S01E06

programme.title: Sykes
programme.desc:
Spy Ring: Eric and Hattie become suspicious of their vodka-swilling, well-off new neighbours. Vintage comedy, starring Eric Sykes and Hattie Jacques
S02E03

programme.title: Eric Sykes: One of the Great Troupers
programme.desc: The veteran comedian takes to the stage of the Theatre Royal, Lincoln, where he gives a tongue-in-cheek account of his follies and fortunes as an actor, gag writer and comedian in theatre, radio and TV. He also pays tribute to Hattie Jacques and Richard Watts, the co-stars of his long-running Sykes sitcom, and there are appearances from Eddie Lester, John Evans and Tony Hayes

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Annapurna to Everest: In the village of Lekhani in Nepal, Michael watches potential Gurkha recruits being put through their paces. He then commences the 4,200m ascent to Annapurna Base Camp to help him acclimatise. Next he heads off to Kathmandu to fulfil a regal engagement at the king's palace during the sacred festival of Desain, and observes holy men at the Siva shrine of Pashupatinath
S01E03

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Leeds 1/5: Nursing manager Sarah hosts the first of a week of dinner parties in Leeds, taking inspiration from her husband's Middle Eastern heritage to offer her guests a Turkish fusion menu. Joining her is 28-year-old painter decorator Alex, 45-year-old bridal shop owner Abbi, 60-year-old community centre manager Janet and 56-year-old record label boss Phil. A hilarious evening lies in store, with unexpected tattoos, beauty tips and twerking

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Leeds 2/5: Would-be clairvoyant Janet hosts the second of a week of dinner parties in Leeds and hopes her ghoul-themed dinner party will help her win the cash prize. Part of Janet's plan is to pretend her house is haunted and she has a practical joke lined up for nursing manager Sarah and bridal shop owner Abbi to find. With more surprises in store, will the fright-night theme be enough to ghost Janet into the lead?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Leeds 3/5: Record label owner Phil hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Leeds, hoping to win the 1,000 prize money by serving up a 1970s rock-themed menu. His guests are astounded by his mystery past, and painter and decorator Alex is unimpressed when wedding shop owner Abbi continues to wind him up

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Leeds 4/5: Painter and decorator Alex hosts the fourth night in Leeds, hoping to win the prize money by serving up a cruise-themed menu from around the world - which impresses jealous rival Janet so much, she almost turns violent. Abbi continues to belittle the host - until he reveals he spends his evenings on stage impersonating a famous heart-throb singer. Will his performance bag him the top prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Leeds 5/5: Bridal shop owner Abbi hopes to woo her guests with a wedding-themed party on the final day of the competition in Leeds. All week Abbi and Michael Buble impersonator Alex have had a bit of a banter that has sailed close to the wind. Will the tension take over, or can the wedding theme create an amorous atmosphere that will help Abbi win the 1,000 prize?

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:
Motorbike fan David is keen to move to Almera, but wife Fiona will take some convincing before she leaves Yorkshire. Pilates fan Esther searches for a holiday home in Alicante
S05E08

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:
On the Costa Blanca, Manuel Rodriguez and daughter Sophie are hoping to make a transatlantic dream a reality. Clients Vinny and Julie met a decade ago online, and now American-born Julie and Briton Vinny are hungry for a third location where they can enjoy more romantic rendezvous time together. With 100,000 euros to spend, Vinny's determined to bag them a bargain, but the property must come with one thing - a barbecue
S05E09

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:
In Almera, mother-and-son duo Sharon and Shaun catch up with love birds Janice and Bill who, when their property search began, had only been together six months. Meanwhile in Alicante, husband-and-wife team Damon and Sophie are visiting ex-clients Lisa and Graham who were also looking to permanently leave the UK for sunny Spain along with their son Jamie
S05E10

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:
In Mlaga, previous client Neal returns to ask the Hamiltons for their help again. This time, the sports fanatic wants a beachfront property where he can simply walk out of his door and onto his paddleboard, all for a budget of 300,000 euros. With front-line Mlaga properties at a premium, the Hamiltons have their work cut out. In Almera, mother-and-son team Sharon and Shaun Garner are poised to help Sue and Don find their dream holiday home for their budget of 140,000 euros. The couple want to get as much bang for their buck as possible in their preferred location of Los Gallardos
S05E12

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2019: Estepona, Spain: Angie and Neelesh met 30 years ago on the London Underground, and now with retirement on the horizon they think the time is right to buy a holiday home in their favourite Spanish town of Estepona. The couple have their hearts set on a new build property and have asked Laura Hamilton to help find them the perfect one. Laura lines up various options for their maximum budget of 260,000, but will any impress them enough to make an offer?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: Alicante: Vicky O'Grady and Simon Stevenson are both passionate about Spain and their greyhounds. Vicky has retired and Simon wants to live and work abroad, so they're ready to make their dream life in the sun a reality, near Alicante. Jasmine Harman helps them find a new home in Alicante on their budget of 70,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman heads to the inland towns and villages of Almera province in southern Spain to help Candy and Mark find the perfect holiday home before their wedding in six months

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: Benalmadena, Costa del Sol: Jo Salt and her daughter Frankie hope to buy a holiday home near Benalmadena in Spain's Costa del Sol for the whole family to enjoy quality time in. Working to their budget of 130,000, Ben Hillman shows them five potential properties

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2023: Peyia, Cyprus: Jasmine Harman travels to Peyia in western Cyprus to help Pauline and Chris find their perfect holiday home on a budget of 80,000

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc:
Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search Oxfordshire for the perfect properties. Reena is looking for a geographical balance between her work in Oxford and her family in the Midlands, after house-hunting on and off for five years she enlists the help of Kirstie in the hope of bringing her search to an end. Tan and Steve live an hour apart and are looking for a place to call their own, Phil has his work cut out searching for the open-plan living space they want in the expensive area they are searching in
S39E01

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc:
East Essex 2021: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of ex-advertising man Geoff, who is selling his luxury villa in Spain and moving into a caravan while he project manages the construction of a dramatically cantilevered steel-framed house on the Essex coast, costing a total of 700,000. But after the anchoring steel has been drilled into the ground, he runs into the double trouble - Covid-19 and a collapse in the Spanish property market. Will he ever finish this complicated - and expensive - construction?
S21E07

programme.title: The Windsors
programme.desc: Comedy soap opera from the writers of Star Stories that imagines the royal family as they have never been seen before

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
A 76-year-old man sustains a head injury after falling down some stairs, and his daughter reflects on how his caring for her mother through her dementia has left him exhausted. A five-year-old girl is brought into the paediatric department with a large splinter lodged in her bottom, and a patient has a lump on her shoulder that has developed since having a fall five weeks ago
S24E03

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The opinionated TV viewers pass judgement on the best and worst shows of December 2013, including Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone, A Great British Christmas with Sarah Beeny and I'm a Celebrity, Get Me Out of Here!
S02E11

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The armchair critics scrutinise The Masked Singer, Trigger Point, Pam & Tommy, First Dates: Valentine's, Dancing on Ice, Dragons' Den, Mary Beard's Forgotten Art, and offer their take of a BBC News report on the rising cost of living
S19E01

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc:
It's My Milk Now: Contenders Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Jenny Eclair, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Mae Martin continue to address the challenges set for them. Greg Davies has some tricky judging to do when people question the definition of the colour gold and nobody understands a simple egg-shelling task. As usual, Alex Horne offers sterling support to all concerned
S15E06

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc:
Married couple Abbie and Charlie join host Anna Richardson and feature as the first picker pair as they search for another woman to join their relationship. Plus 41 year-old actor and glamour puss Chrissie from Leeds is hoping to find husband number four
S11E03

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc:
Marge Simpson in 'Screaming Yellow Honkers': Marge is delighted to get behind the wheel of a rugged all-terrain vehicle, but her new-found sense of power quickly turns into road rage, something Chief Wiggum is very keen to stamp out
S10E15

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien continue their mission to repurpose old cast-offs into cash, making an extraordinary find from a Dutch designer in accountant Debbie's lean-to
S05E06

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien are in Surrey, where they visit a collector of Kawasaki motorbikes
S05E07

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
In Dumfries and Galloway, Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole meet Alan, who works in the forestry business. Henry decides to give four bar stools a dayglo makeover, while Simon transforms two old sheep shearer seats into an extraordinary bench
S05E08

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc:
A derelict building in a French village gets a new lease of life. Meanwhile, in Portugal, a couple dip their toes into their first season as holiday hosts, and in southern France, a very special event takes place in a refurbished chapel
S01E20

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc:
Francesca and Carl, the owners of an Italian hamlet - which they have turned into a holiday complex - welcome the first guests of the season

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc:
An unexpected delivery causes chaos at a medieval village in France. Meanwhile, Francesca and Carl, the owners of a hilltop hamlet in Italy, get started on a brand-new project

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2023: Gran Canaria: Jean Johansson helps Ryan and Steve find a holiday home in the resort of Maspalomas on the island of Gran Canaria on a budget of 150,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: Murcia: Lynn and Gerald are looking for a holiday home in the north of Spain's Murcia region, where they can enjoy the Mediterranean sunshine and numerous golf courses the area has to offer. Ben Hillman lines up five options within their budget of 100,000, hoping at least one will encourage the pair to make an offer

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2023: Costa del Sol: Janet and Andrew have been longing to retire to the Spanish sunshine of the western Costa del Sol for 10 years, so call on the expertise of Danni Menzies to seek put five impressive properties for their budget of 200,000 to for them to choose between

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2023: Crete: Craig Rowe jets off to eastern Crete to help Andy and Vicky find their dream holiday home where they can enjoy the Cretan sun and Greek way of life. It's a special place for the couple, who have holidayed there together eight times. Craig shows Andy and Vicky five properties for them to consider, within their budget of 90,000

programme.title: The Italian Job (1969)
programme.desc: A crook assembles a motley gang to steal 4million in gold bullion from an Italian armoured car, which brings Turin to a standstill and enables the robbers to make a quick getaway in a fleet of Minis - but they end up falling foul of the Mafia along the way. Crime comedy, starring Michael Caine, Noel Coward, Benny Hill, Tony Beckley and John Le Mesurier

programme.title: Night Coppers
programme.desc:
PC Sophie has to deal with a flirty suspect in a street brawl and PC Vic arrests a young man on suspicion of GBH. PCs Roger and Jess are called in when a Santa bus comes under attack, with Father Christmas pelted with soft mints, although their night gets tougher when they are called to deal with an irate suspect at a nightclub
S01E08

programme.title: Star Trek Beyond (2016)
programme.desc: The USS Enterprise sets out on a rescue mission which turns out to be a deadly trap set by a mysterious warlord. The crew are left stranded on an unexplored planet, and join forces with a fugitive alien scavenger to find a way off the hostile world and prevent a terrible weapon being unleashed upon the galaxy. Sci-fi adventure, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Idris Elba

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc:
Jimmy Carr hosts the game show mash-up, with Rachel Riley and Susie Dent. Jon Richardson and Sara Pascoe take on Sean Lock and Richard Ayoade. Nick Helm joins Susie in Dictionary Corner
S21E04

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc:
Married couple Abbie and Charlie join host Anna Richardson and feature as the first picker pair as they search for another woman to join their relationship. Plus 41 year-old actor and glamour puss Chrissie from Leeds is hoping to find husband number four
S11E03

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc:
Revisit: Isle of Wight, 2012: In 2010, architectural designer Lincoln Miles and artist Lisa Traxler found an uninspiring 1970s bungalow on a plot on the Isle of Wight surrounded by ancient woodland. As part of their renovation project, they added a three-storey 'tower' extension and used a range of unconventional techniques and alternative materials. Two years later, Kevin McCloud returned to find out whether the couple's methods led to success
S12E09

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Life in the Country
programme.desc:
Sarah and Graham turn their attention to the family room and how best to use the empty space downstairs. They draw inspiration from the Chinese bedroom at Longleat House and the plant-based textiles and natural dyes on display at London Fashion Week. Sarah realises that she can't carry on working in random parts of the house, so comes up with a plan to seamlessly weave her workspace into the living area.
S03E03

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc:
Working from Home: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back at two shows highlighting the way working from home is changing the way many people live. Northampton newlyweds Nikki and Andy both worked from home but their cluttered terrace was close to bursting point. Meanwhile, Amber ran her own fitness classes from her home and wanted somewhere brighter and bigger for her clients. Could Kirstie persuade them to go with her redesigns or would Phil find either couple a much more suitable new place?
S01E05

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Glasgow 1/5: Business manager Alison Bennett hosts the first dinner party in Glasgow, where she hopes that her Thai menu of chicken satay, red-roasted pork and chili chocolate combs will help to secure her the 1,000 prize. However, it remains to be seen whether any of her guests are able to use the chopsticks she has provided

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Married couple Lynne and Ian kick off the competition in Gateshead, Tyne and Wear, with a menu of hearty treats. On day two newlyweds Jess and Connor cook up a Greek meal - including a rather large mezze - followed by a Greek dance and some plate smashing. After two high-energy dinner parties, engaged couple Tom and Sam's chances rest on their banana souffle
S2020E28

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2015: Murcia: Laura Hamilton helps Surinder Bedi and her son Narinder find a holiday home for the whole family in the Murcia region on Spain's Mediterranean coast. With a cash budget of 70,000, Laura shows them a selection of property contenders that offer good value, but will they go for an apartment by the beach or a villa with a pool?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Menorca: Angela Keenan and Jon Benbow-Brown have visited Menorca five times together, and have fallen in love with the laid-back way of life on the island. The pair are planning to retire there full-time, so Ben Hillman shows them five houses on the island for their budget of 165,000

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:
On the Costa Blanca, married estate agents Sophie and Damon help Perthshire pair Betty and Gordon find the Alicante holiday home they have long wished for. The couple are determined not to leave Spain until the agents find them their perfect pad. On the Costa del Sol, newly engaged couple Chloe and Richard have 300,000 euros to spend on a villa that needs to accommodate them and their future family. Estate agent Kerry is challenged with fulfilling their long wish list, but things become more difficult when a potential property surprises the seasoned agent
S05E13

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc:
Anneli, the manager of a restored medieval village in France, is having a tricky time setting up the last wedding party of the season. Elsewhere, the owners of a French hamlet celebrate their first restored building. Finally, passionate estate agent Mark spends his life hunting derelict villages in Galicia
S01E05

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
In the Lake District, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien meet Tamara, whose family have been farming there for nearly a century. Simon has ambitious plans to turn a pile of old slate into an unusual lamp, while Henry sets his heart on upcycling the seat from an old pony and trap
S05E10

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Kent 1/5: On the first night in Kent, 51-year-old construction site manager and part-time bouncer Mark hopes that his dinner party can be as much about the party as it is about the dinner, as he hosts a cheesy fun-fuelled evening. Will party poppers, balloons, confetti cannons and surprising celebrity stories impress 53-year-old dog-lover Karen, 39-year-old Czech shop assistant Verush, 42-year-old singer Amrick and 58-year-old fashion photographer Anthony?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Kent 2/5: On the second night in Kent, competitive sales assistant Verush is going all out to win by hosting a Czech-themed evening, but ex-stripper Mark isn't impressed, comparing Verush's pasta to MDF and pastry to leather, while the first night's argument between dog lover Karen and photographer Anthony is reignited

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Kent 3/5: Dog enthusiast Karen hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Kent, hoping to impress her guests by serving up a menu inspired by her four-legged friends. After the cheesy fun of the previous night, she is determined to impress her guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Kent 4/5: Amrick takes his turn to host in Kent, hoping to wow his guests by revealing his musical talents and with his traditional Indian cuisine. But with dog-lover Karen and competitive Verush not liking hot and spicy food, there could be trouble - while photographer Anthony questions ex-stripper Mark's dress sense

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Kent 5/5: Photographer Anthony attempts to wow his guests with an evening of fine food and culinary excellence on the final day of the competition in Kent. However, the soiree is jeopardised by ex-stripper Mark on overdrive and dog-lover Karen showcasing some incredible impressions from animals to Anthony himself. The host might be cockily confident he can win, but Karen seemingly remains in pole position to bag the 1,000 prize

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Leah Charles-King helps a semi-retired lawyer and a retired firefighter to make a permanent move together to the mountain villages of Mlaga Province in southern Spain

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc:
Nervous young labrador Loki arrives at the centre, and soon meets seasoned dog owner Sharron, a Royal Navy nurse. But will a recent injury prevent her from taking him in? Small terrier Midnight is also looking for a forever home, although when he is introduced to a couple dealing with the pain of not being able to have children, he only has eyes for one of them
S01E06

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc:
Paramedics tend to a young mum having a panic attack while out with her son. Cameras also focus on a two-year-old who is running a high temperature

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the week's biggest and best shows

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:

S19E01

programme.title: Andrew: The Problem Prince
programme.desc:
The second of two programmes telling the inside story of Prince Andrew's 2019 Newsnight interview with Emily Maitlis and the subsequent chain of events that led to a royal disaster. In the 1980s, Andrew was a Falklands war hero and a national heart-throb, glory years that culminated in his marriage to Sarah Ferguson. But following his departure from the Navy, his image took a turn as his new role as trade envoy proved unsuccessful - and his need to fund a lavish lifestyle and friendship with Jeffrey Epstein eventually prompted the interview that cemented his downfall
S01E02

programme.title: Prince Andrew: The Musical
programme.desc: All-singing, all-dancing satirical biopic charting the rise and fall of the Duke of York. With seven hilarious original musical numbers and revealing archive footage, the Duke of York's downfall gets a West End-style treatment, as Andrew goes from '80s war hero to present-day royal outcast amid damaging allegations and an ill-advised Newsnight interview. Written by and starring Kieran Hodgson, with Emma Sidi, Munya Chawawa and Harry Enfield

programme.title: The Windsors
programme.desc: Comedy soap opera from the writers of Star Stories that imagines the royal family as they have never been seen before

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc:
Jimmy Carr hosts the game show mash-up, with Rachel Riley and Susie Dent. Jon Richardson and Sara Pascoe take on Sean Lock and Richard Ayoade. Nick Helm joins Susie in Dictionary Corner
S21E04

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc:
Married couple Abbie and Charlie join host Anna Richardson and feature as the first picker pair as they search for another woman to join their relationship. Plus 41 year-old actor and glamour puss Chrissie from Leeds is hoping to find husband number four
S11E03

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc:
Chester's 18 chimpanzees face upheaval when new female chimp Vila arrives from a zoo in Germany. Meanwhile, nine-year-old cheetah mum Kinky Tail is vomiting after meals, and her three-year-old daughter Safi must watch and wait as her mum is taken to the zoo's medical centre. Cameras also follow Asian short-clawed otter Annie, who recently gave birth to a large litter of five pups
S03E03

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Glasgow 2/5: Butcher Graeme Curley hosts the second night in Glasgow, where he has planned a meaty menu complete with pork ribs. He hopes to wow his guests by serving steak - and by bringing some of his trade to the dinner table

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
In Belfast, three couples compete to host the best dinner party. Sarah and Paddy kick things off with a fine-dining feast for guests Louise and Danny and Emma and Samson. The hosts mix Eastern and traditional fare. Then, on night two Emma and Samson treat their guests to some Mozambican delights. After a first course that whistles and wows, palates need to be cleansed for the main course, but a chilly chat about ice-cream leaves Louise red in the face. On the final night, Louise and Danny confound everyone's expectations with a sailing-based starter. A spot of model behaviour excites the guests, and a mountain of meringue impresses, but is it enough to win the 1,000 prize?
